current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission from issuing certain decisions that will raise
			 costs for ratepayers, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

header.#text: Prohibition against certain FERC decisions that will raise costs for ratepayers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall publish a cost-benefit analysis of such decision, including the
			 likely financial impact of such decision on ratepayers.

text.#text: Prior to issuing a decision described in subsection (b), the
This section applies to any decision by the
authorize the creation of a new capacity zone; or

affect the supply and demand curves or models used to determine prices at points in a capacity
			 zone.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines, through a cost-benefit analysis published
			 under subsection (a), that a decision described in subsection (b) will
			 raise costs for ratepayers, then the Commission may not issue such
			 decision.

text.#text: This section takes effect on January 1, 2014.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2928 IS: To prohibit the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission from issuing certain decisions that will raise costs for ratepayers, and for other purposes.
